attributes.action: Repeat the school year 2019/20 due to covid19
attributes.additional_details:
Asking young children to social distance with their friends is simply impossible. It will have a negative effect on their mental health.
If they were to repeat a year there wouldn't be the pressure to get them back into school too soon and risk another spike.
Those children / teenagers who have worked so hard towards their SATS, GCSEs and A levels have missed out on taking their exams and achieving a grade they truely deserve.
attributes.background: I am asking for you.to consider schools repeating the academic school year 2019/20. That way we could delay sending our children back to school too early putting them teachers and parents at risk.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Repeat the current school year from Sept 2020: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319171

Require schools to allow children the option to retake their year next year: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309265

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
